dataset/provenance: Source: Pinus taeda resequencing data, not further specified.  Training set is composed of a total of 300 validated sequences.  Test set is composed of 120 independent sequences, with 563 manually validated SNPs.
evaluation/comparison: Polyphred, Polybayes. Used for generating the features.
evaluation/method: Independent dataset of 120 unique sequences with 563 manually validated SNPs. Validation = All SNP calls were identified as based on visual inspection of Polyphred and Polybayes predictions in Consed.
model/availability: Broken link (http://dendrome.ucdavis.edu/adept2/ resequencing.html). The customized pipeline for feature extraction is reported in a new link:   https://nealelab.ucdavis.edu/adept2-overview/pinesap/
model/interpretability: Input features are transparent (Sequence Depth, Local Average Quality, Alignment Quality) while their combination is not interpretable (Black box).
model/output: Binary classifier (SNP predictions accepted or rejected).
optimization/algorithm: J48 Algorithm For Decision Tree (WEKA)   Decision tree J48 is the implementation of algorithm ID3 (Iterative Dichotomiser 3) developed by the WEKA project team.
optimization/features: Sequence-based statistics were derived through a customized feature extraction program and fed as a vector for each polymorphism to the J48 classification tree available in the WEKA classifier package.  9 features were used to enhance polymorphism prediction accuracy (as reported in https://nealelab.ucdavis.edu/adept2-overview/pinesap/).
publication/authors: Wegrzyn JL, Lee JM, Liechty J, Neale DB.
publication/title: PineSAP--sequence alignment and SNP identification pipeline.

dataset/availability: Yes. They used a public dataset published in a previous paper. Paper doi: 10.1109/ACCESS.2020.3010287
dataset/provenance: Public dataset of Chest X Rays scans labeled for "normal", "viral pneumonia", and "COVID-19". N_normal = 1341; N_viral_pneumonia = 1345; N_covid19 = 219. Used in previous papers.
dataset/redundancy: Only one dataset is used. They used 5-fold cross-validation on the dataset for evaluation.
dataset/splits: No test or validation set used. They used 5-fold cross-validation on the dataset for evaluation. Distribution of the classes in the splits not stated.
evaluation/comparison: Compared with other methods presented in literature.
evaluation/confidence: No confidence intervals or statistical significance provided.
evaluation/measure: Accuracy, F1 score, Recall, and Precision
optimization/algorithm: Combination of three DenseNet-121, the output of which was combined in a final fully connected layer.
optimization/encoding: The classifier input data are generated by an unsupervised ML algorithm (MS-AdaNet). No transformation is stated for the input data of MS-AdaNet.
optimization/features: The inputs of the algorithm are three images. The definition of the images is not stated.
optimization/meta: Yes. The classifier input data are generated using an unsupervised ML algorithm extracting three image features from Chest X Rays scans. Such unsupervised ML algorithm is a convolutional adversarial network (they call that "MS-AdaNet").  They train and test MS-AdaNet on a independent dataset to prove its ability in extrating features. However they trained this algorithm also on the dataset use for classification when the MS-AdaNet is used as input for the classifier.
optimization/regularization: No overfitting prevention strategy is mentioned.
publication/authors: An J, Cai Q, Qu Z, Gao Z.
publication/journal: IEEE journal of biomedical and health informatics
publication/title: COVID-19 Screening in Chest X-Ray Images Using Lung Region Priors.

dataset/availability: Yes.    Raw and processed microarray data used in this study is available via Gene Expression Omnibus at: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/query/acc.cgi?token=bviftkociimgsnk&acc=GSE20098
dataset/provenance: CD4 T-cell transcriptomes from 173 UK patients, of which N_pos = 72  (RA, i.e. outcome Rheumatoid Arthritis), N_neg =101 (outcome Non-RA).  Not used in previous papers.
dataset/splits: 111 patients in training set, of which N_pos_train = 47  (RA), N_neg_train = 64 (Non-RA).    62 patients in testing set, of which N_pos_test = 25  (RA), N_neg_test = 37 (Non-RA).   42.3% positives on training set.   40.3% positives on test set.
evaluation/comparison: A transcriptional ‘risk metrics’ for ACPA-negative patients was bild, and the AUROC curve of the 12-gene signature was compared to the existing ‘Leiden prediction rule’ as a predictor of RA in the test set.   No difference in the performance was seen in this case.  However, by combining all features of the Leiden prediction rule with the 12-gene risk metric, and applying it to the ACPA-negative UA cohort (test set), the AUROC curve value improved from 0.74, SEM=0.08 (original Leiden prediction rule) to 0.84; SEM=0.06 (modified metric incorporating gene signature).
evaluation/confidence: AUROC curve (original Leiden prediction rule)=0.74; SEM=0.08 versus area under ROC curve (modified metric incorporating gene signature)=0.84; SEM=0.06; p<0.001 in both cases.
evaluation/measure: Sensitivity, specificity, positive and negative likelihood ratio.
model/interpretability: No statement about ante-hoc interpretability of the model is made by the authors.   SVM is generally considered black box.   Post-hoc analysis indicates that PB CD4 T cells in early RA are characterised by a predominant upregulation of biological pathways involved in cell cycle progression (ACPA-positive) and survival, death and apoptosis (ACPA-negative).  ( ACPA = anti-citrullinated peptide antibodies)
optimization/features: f = 12.   Starting from 16,205 genes, 12 genes were at the end selected as differentially expressed in RA versus non-RA patients.  Differential expression was defined as a fold-change cut-off of 1.2, combined with a significance level cut-off of p<0.05 (Welch’s t-test), corrected for multiple testing using the false-discovery-rate method of Benjamini.
optimization/parameters: The authors do not mention parameters numbers different from standard.
publication/authors: Pratt AG, Swan DC, Richardson S, Wilson G, Hilkens CM, Young DA, Isaacs JD.
publication/title: A CD4 T cell gene signature for early rheumatoid arthritis implicates interleukin 6-mediated STAT3 signalling, particularly in anti-citrullinated peptide antibody-negative disease.

publication/authors: Jing R, Li P, Ding Z, Lin X, Zhao R, Shi L, Yan H, Liao J, Zhuo C, Lu L, Fan Y.
publication/title: Machine learning identifies unaffected first-degree relatives with functional network patterns and cognitive impairment similar to those of schizophrenia patients.
